description: A 2nd CE octagonal masonry shrine within a ditched enclosure on the flank of a Bronze Age barrow with ancillary building. Dismantled during the 3rd CE but was re-established in the early 4th CE as a square post-built shrine on the crown of the barrow. Again was dismantled in the mid 4th CE due to flooding but now abandoned.
bibliography: Evans, C, and I Hodder. “Marshland Communities and Cultural Landscapes.” McDonald Institute for Archaeological Research, 2006.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Haddenham Roman Shrine (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rudling, David. Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, 2008.
